doc.after: Geomatics is a branch of geography that has emerged since the quantitative revolution in geography in the mid 1950s Geomatics involves the use of traditional spatial techniques used in cartography and topography and their application to computers Geomatics has become a widespread field with many other disciplines using techniques such as GIS and remote sensing Geomatics has also led to a revitalization of some geography departments especially in Northern America where the subject had a declining status during the 1950s
